newsitem.title: POLAND: POLAND'S LUBLIN TO OFFER PLN 11 MLN MUNIS IN MAY.
newsitem.headline: POLAND'S LUBLIN TO OFFER PLN 11 MLN MUNIS IN MAY.

text.p: The southeastern Polish city of Lublin will offer three-year municipal bonds worth 11 million zlotys, with a coupon of 100-140 bp above the 52-week T-bill, at a private placement in May, a city official said on Monday.
"Funds from the 11 million zloty municipal bond issue will be used to purchase 14 busses," Miroslawa Puton, deputy-head of Lublin's finance department told Reuters.
Puton also said that Lublin would issue four million zlotys of one-year municipal bonds in November of this year.
Last November Lublin sold 11 million zlotys worth of one-year bonds with a coupon of 100 basis points above the average yield of 52-week T-bill at a minimum price of 100.01.
Puton said that Lublin was mulling listing its bonds on Poland's newly formed regulated over-the counter (CTO) market, but said that no decisions had yet been made.
This year's issues are part of Lublin's 90 million zloty municipal bond programme scheduled to run until the year 2000.
